summary: The only reason Sansa wears the hairnet is because she was being nice to Dontos, she didn't buy into his "It's magic" bullshit. ...
question: The only reason Sansa wears the hairnet is because she was being nice to Dontos, she didn't buy into his "It's magic" bullshit.  What would the Tyrells have done if she made a last minute fashion choice and simply decided not to wear the hairnet?
answer:
Well…book!Sansa she doesn’t think it’s magic, but she was always going to wear the hairnet.

“It’s very lovely,” Sansa said, thinking, It is a ship I need, not a net for my hair.

“Lovelier than you know, sweet child. It’s magic, you see. It’s justice you hold. It’s vengeance for your father.” Dontos leaned close and kissed her again. “It’s home.”

- Sansa VIII, ACoK

Book!Sansa doesn’t know how, but she knows the hairnet is part of a plan to help her escape King’s Landing. After all that time meeting Dontos, after all those dashed hopes to leave, she’s wearing that hairnet.

Show!Sansa’s situation, on the other hand, is much more like what you describe. And yes, it’s a significant weakness in the story.

blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

tags: I just feel so bad for sansa
summary: I agreed with you. The narrative want Arya to be seen as this outcast, underdog, bullied individual that we are supposed to root...
question: I agreed with you. The narrative want Arya to be seen as this outcast, underdog, bullied individual that we are supposed to root for. Yet, the evidences show otherwise. Arya is the bully. She got pampered and get away with everything. Even, when she breaking the rules, she is not the who have to pay the price. Lady is murdered to pay for her and Nymeria actions. Yet, Arya is the one who got consoled by her father. While, Sansa was abandoned, grieving alone. As if Nymeria is not alive and free.
answer:
Couldn’t agree more. This is why I’m baffled how so many people accuse Sansa of being spoiled. All the kids are sheltered and privileged in books and show, but in the show it’s exactly as you say. Arya somehow got away with humiliating Sansa in front of their own court and the Royal Family and got no worse punishment than sent to her room- not something she would probably protest very loudly. Her brothers, Theon, even Jeyne Poole (who hates Arya in the books) laugh at this mischievous scamp, putting salt on the wound. What’s Sansa being spoiled with and how is Arya the outcast here?

It’s also Sansa who gets punished for other people’s actions- Sansa loses her wolf and earns Joffrey’s ire for Nymeria and Arya attacking him, she gets beaten for Robb winning battles, Arya even blames her for drawing Mordane’s attention when she’s the one being loud.

tags: not anti arya but her stans will freak out if I don't tag it
summary: Wow GRRM is biased when it comes to Arya? In the books or show Arya?
question: Wow GRRM is biased when it comes to Arya? In the books or show Arya?
answer:
Books for sure. It’s more in book 1 where he almost villainizes Sansa to make Arya look more sympathetic. Sansa we’re supposed to see as too naive and trusting while Arya hates the Lannisters (although not initially because they’re evil). Sansa isn’t close with his favorite male characters like Arya is. She’s the one who says something particularly mean in their worst fight while Arya tries to comfort her about leaving. Sansa’s feminine skills are not presented as important as Arya’s skills with weapons, foraging, etc are. And then there’s how he pretends Sansa played a part in Ned’s downfall and only Sansa (as if Ned needed any help doing that). Those are off the top of my head.

GRRM is not that involved in the show so it’s pretty hard for him to be biased there. D&D certainly are (much more so in earlier seasons though).

blog.name: princess-of-the-day
blog.title: A Princess Every Day!
blog.description: Just another daily character blog... featuring your favorite princesses!

summary: Today’s Princess of the Day is: Sansa Stark, from Game of Thrones. Growing up as the eldest daughter of House Stark, Sansa...
caption:
Today’s Princess of the Day is: Sansa Stark, from Game of Thrones.

Growing up as the eldest daughter of House Stark, Sansa wishes to emulate her mother’s example of a “proper lady,” and is firmly devoted to traditional feminine virtues. When her brother Robb declares himself the King of the North, she is temporarily granted the title of princess.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: thedropletsparkled
blog.title: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind.
blog.description:
I'm interested in fantasy, fantasy art, A Song of Ice and Fire / Game of Thrones, SanSan, vegan recipes and creative writing.
My main blog with my own fanfiction, drawings and some poems:
http://maracuyakongeen.livejournal.com/
My fanfiction on AO3: http://archiveofourown.org/users/Maracuya/works

Disclaimer: I do not own my works of fanfiction/fanart. I do not profit from the stories or drawings, nor would I ever seek to do so. All credit for characters,plot and settings go to the respective original author or artist.

title: SanSan gifts I’ve got
body:
Over the years, I’ve got so many lovely SanSan fics, so I wanted to share them with you here since there are such great writers out there. Listing complete fics here.

  1. Canon AU. Alayne wargs (first time warging) from the Vale into Sandor while he’s recovering on the Quiet Isle - and while Sandor is talking to the Elder Brother (~ Ray) about her! —— Bonus points for manly tears… or for Sandor wanking after the Elder Brother has left. 
  2. Series of 3 sentence memes.
  3. AU in which the direwolves can talk - and they root for Sandor.
  4. A SanSan crossover with Orpheus and Eurydice, only WITH A HAPPY ENDING. I’d love to see Sandor haggle with the Stranger/Hades and soothing Cerberus. And him dealing with the flames of the underworld…
  5. Someone talks to Joffrey about women being able to fake lust. Joff, who has just dropped Sansa as his betrothed, orders his Hound to pretend to fuck Sansa, and Sansa is supposed to fake her lust. The two start the mummery. What nobody notices is that Sansa isn’t just acting. Only when she dozes off does Sandor realize the little bird has just peaked for the first time - live on stage, so to speak. And clueless Joff is so impressed by the mummery, he thinks it is the best jape ever to order the two to marry.
  6. Westeros has suffered greatly from an outbreak of Greyscales: whole villages have been wiped out, and some noble families, too. Robb has become the new Lord of Winterfell. Now, that Edmure Tully - as the last direct heir - has passed away, too, King Robert orders Sansa to take over Riverrun - and to marry Sandor Clegane. It’s part of a new royal wedding strategy so as to help the regions recover as quickly as possible. (Who are the other siblings destined to marry?)Bonus: The direwolves are alive.+++ Bonus: Some of the greatest baddies have been wiped out by the plague, too.
  7. Prompt: “a fairy grants Sandor a wish, and he must choose between a face without scars, Gregor dead, or a marriage to his little bird. Or something else that’s fairy-tale-ish.”
  8. Kings Landing crack!AU. Sandor’s cock starts to talk to Sandor. And due to his size, he’s far more self-confident than the rest of Sandor. Only he’s also extremely. .. demanding and drives Sandor nuts and into embarrassing situations. No matter what Sandor does to appease his member: it becomes clear that he’ll only find peace inside a certain little bird.
  9. Modern AU… Delayed orgasm. Sansa wears/has to wear a strap-on vibrator under her skirt at a dinner party or somewhere public (Joffrey forcing her? Or no Joff, but a lost bet?). Then, Sansa notices that Sandor gets into control of the remote control - and Sandor is enthusiastic to watch Sansa desperately trying to control herself.
  10. Sansa’s musings about Sandor’s surprisingly gentle (and hella sexy, big) hands.Different times Sansa studies The Hound’s hands.
  11. Joffrey forces Sansa to bathe the Hound after betrothing the couple.
  12. Sansa has sneaked into a room that is not hers, eaten food not hers, drank strongwine not hers, and fallen asleep in a bed not hers. What happens when the real occupant of the room returns, removes his tunic and washes himself, initially completely unaware of his uninvited visitor? A prompt fill, ACOK era.
  13. Sansa and Sandor both accidentally drink from a wineskin containing a love-philtre. A GOT AU where Sansa is aged-up.
  14. Sandor and/or Sansa encounter(s) Ned’s ghost - and post-mortem Ned Stark has become a total SanSan fan.
  15. Sansa tames Stranger, and in the process Sandor comes to grips with a new role in life after leaving the Quiet Isle.
  16. Sansa and Sandor on a pub crawl in either King’s Landing or Oldtown.+ Bonus points if Sansa doesn’t notice she’s getting drunk; ++ More bonus points for the Hound singing/rasping about the “Dog and the Maiden Fair”; +++ More bonus points for Sandor and some other ASoIaF character having a drinking contest.

Sansa and Sandor on a pub crawl in either King’s Landing or Oldtown.+ Bonus points if Sansa doesn’t notice she’s getting drunk; ++ More bonus points for the Hound singing/rasping about the “Dog and the Maiden Fair”; +++ More bonus points for Sandor and some other ASoIaF character having a drinking contest.
trail.content:
Over the years, I’ve got so many lovely SanSan fics, so I wanted to share them with you here since there are such great writers out there. Listing complete fics here.

  1. Canon AU. Alayne wargs (first time warging) from the Vale into Sandor while he’s recovering on the Quiet Isle - and while Sandor is talking to the Elder Brother (~ Ray) about her! —— Bonus points for manly tears… or for Sandor wanking after the Elder Brother has left. 
  2. Series of 3 sentence memes.
  3. AU in which the direwolves can talk - and they root for Sandor.
  4. A SanSan crossover with Orpheus and Eurydice, only WITH A HAPPY ENDING. I’d love to see Sandor haggle with the Stranger/Hades and soothing Cerberus. And him dealing with the flames of the underworld…
  5. Someone talks to Joffrey about women being able to fake lust. Joff, who has just dropped Sansa as his betrothed, orders his Hound to pretend to fuck Sansa, and Sansa is supposed to fake her lust. The two start the mummery. What nobody notices is that Sansa isn’t just acting. Only when she dozes off does Sandor realize the little bird has just peaked for the first time - live on stage, so to speak. And clueless Joff is so impressed by the mummery, he thinks it is the best jape ever to order the two to marry.
  6. Westeros has suffered greatly from an outbreak of Greyscales: whole villages have been wiped out, and some noble families, too. Robb has become the new Lord of Winterfell. Now, that Edmure Tully - as the last direct heir - has passed away, too, King Robert orders Sansa to take over Riverrun - and to marry Sandor Clegane. It’s part of a new royal wedding strategy so as to help the regions recover as quickly as possible. (Who are the other siblings destined to marry?)Bonus: The direwolves are alive.+++ Bonus: Some of the greatest baddies have been wiped out by the plague, too.
  7. Prompt: “a fairy grants Sandor a wish, and he must choose between a face without scars, Gregor dead, or a marriage to his little bird. Or something else that’s fairy-tale-ish.”
  8. Kings Landing crack!AU. Sandor’s cock starts to talk to Sandor. And due to his size, he’s far more self-confident than the rest of Sandor. Only he’s also extremely. .. demanding and drives Sandor nuts and into embarrassing situations. No matter what Sandor does to appease his member: it becomes clear that he’ll only find peace inside a certain little bird.
  9. Modern AU… Delayed orgasm. Sansa wears/has to wear a strap-on vibrator under her skirt at a dinner party or somewhere public (Joffrey forcing her? Or no Joff, but a lost bet?). Then, Sansa notices that Sandor gets into control of the remote control - and Sandor is enthusiastic to watch Sansa desperately trying to control herself.
  10. Sansa’s musings about Sandor’s surprisingly gentle (and hella sexy, big) hands.Different times Sansa studies The Hound’s hands.
  11. Joffrey forces Sansa to bathe the Hound after betrothing the couple.
  12. Sansa has sneaked into a room that is not hers, eaten food not hers, drank strongwine not hers, and fallen asleep in a bed not hers. What happens when the real occupant of the room returns, removes his tunic and washes himself, initially completely unaware of his uninvited visitor? A prompt fill, ACOK era.
  13. Sansa and Sandor both accidentally drink from a wineskin containing a love-philtre. A GOT AU where Sansa is aged-up.
  14. Sandor and/or Sansa encounter(s) Ned’s ghost - and post-mortem Ned Stark has become a total SanSan fan.
  15. Sansa tames Stranger, and in the process Sandor comes to grips with a new role in life after leaving the Quiet Isle.
  16. Sansa and Sandor on a pub crawl in either King’s Landing or Oldtown.+ Bonus points if Sansa doesn’t notice she’s getting drunk; ++ More bonus points for the Hound singing/rasping about the “Dog and the Maiden Fair”; +++ More bonus points for Sandor and some other ASoIaF character having a drinking contest.

tags: and we got the whole damn fam bam
which is exactly what my fam thanksgiving is!!!!
summary:
Tater Tot Hotdish | 
          Chapter 17
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
title:
Tater Tot Hotdish | 
          Chapter 17
        |
        Minnesota, State Of...
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“Mother Earth, and Jesus Christ, we thank you both for the opportunity to be here, and to be blessed by the fruits of the earth. Thank you for giving us a plentiful year, and harvest, and this family,” Ned intoned solemnly. “I ask that you each bless us as we sit here before you, and this meal. We thank Catelyn, Sansa, and Talisa for preparing this meal for us, for Sandor, Benjen, Osha, Lysa, Robin, and Petyr for joining our table. Bring us good health, renewed relationships, and championships for the Gophers. Ski-U-Mah!”

“Amen,” Catelyn corrected balefully and they all let go of hands. Rickon went to grab his fork again eagerly, but Catelyn stopped him. “I would like everyone around the table to say what they are thankful for this year!”

“Mom!” Rickon slumped down in his chair, but left the fork.

“I’ll go first,” Ned said jovially, “I’m grateful for my children, my work, my home, and a beautiful wife who can cook like an angel.”

“I’m grateful for the chance to start a family,” Talisa declared, and Robb grinned at her.

“I’m grateful for this pregnancy almost being over,” he joked, kissing Talisa’s knuckles, “and that my wife is the one doing it.”

“I’m grateful for the chance for new adventures,” Sansa said sweetly, looking at Sandor, who smiled back at her.

We thank Catelyn, Sansa, and Talisa for preparing this meal for us, for Sandor, Benjen, Osha, Lysa, Robin, and Petyr for joining our table. Bring us good health, renewed relationships, and championships for the Gophers. Ski-U-Mah!”

“Amen,” Catelyn corrected balefully and they all let go of hands. Rickon went to grab his fork again eagerly, but Catelyn stopped him. “I would like everyone around the table to say what they are thankful for this year!”

“Mom!” Rickon slumped down in his chair, but left the fork.

“I’ll go first,” Ned said jovially, “I’m grateful for my children, my work, my home, and a beautiful wife who can cook like an angel.”

“I’m grateful for the chance to start a family,” Talisa declared, and Robb grinned at her.

“I’m grateful for this pregnancy almost being over,” he joked, kissing Talisa’s knuckles, “and that my wife is the one doing it.”

“I’m grateful for the chance for new adventures,” Sansa said sweetly, looking at Sandor, who smiled back at her.

blog.description:
Kim, 23 :)

CHAMPIONS DU MONDE !

History, books, movies, series, music.

When she was just a girl, she expected the world, but it flew away from her reach, so she ran away in her sleep, dreamed of para para paradise.

summary: I think a lot of people had a problem with Bran speaking about Sansa's wedding night. But for me, I felt Bran may very well have...
question: I think a lot of people had a problem with Bran speaking about Sansa's wedding night. But for me, I felt Bran may very well have seen what Sansa went through, and he tells her he's sorry she had to go through such horrors in their own home. His emotional senses are very dulled now and his sense of propriety has gone down too (like how he dismissed Meera the way he did), yet he still had enough to let Sansa know he understands she went through hell and empathized with her plight.
answer: I admit I was pretty bitter that he never brought up anyone else’s traumas, just Sansa’s. Like what was the point? Did Sansa express a need to hear someone tell her they empathised with her because of that? If they had written that scene it would have at least shown Bran trying to reach out through the wall of incalculable knowledge he has acquired. At least because of that scene no one can accuse Sansa of stealing his inheritance or anything and despite the show barely featuring Bran I did like the other scenes that they shared. Hopefully S8 will bring more Sansa and Bran because he’s her favourite brother.

summary: some folks get on sansa for not being smart enough to see through joffrey or cersei like arya did. but i've always had the...
question: some folks get on sansa for not being smart enough to see through joffrey or cersei like arya did. but i've always had the thought that maybe the reason why isn't just because sansa saw life as a fairytale, but because of the company she kept. arya was the type to make friends with anyone, from stable boys to bastard sons alike. she'd see a whole different side to the world (& highborns) by being around lowborns a lot, whereas sansa spent all her time with nobles. the pov's are very different.
answer:
True. Not to mention Sansa’s interests were closer to the culture the Lannisters came from. Sansa’s parents went out of their way not to share their apprehensions about the family with her and then Ned left Sansa unsupervised all the time. Of course there was the Trident where Sansa realised though she was not ready to admit it that she’s not as safe as she thought she was and examining that would mean examining the fact that world is awful and her parents aren’t infallible. Plus the tiny detail of Ned killing her wolf, letting Sansa deal with that on her own. Arya had none of these expectations or interactions and wasn’t let down by her father. Like you said two different POVs.

There’s also the small matter of George writing Sansa as a villain because he’s boring like that.
